content.description:
Located on the far-right side of the cliff and identifiable by the tan Fixe hangers on the bolts. Note - a stick clip is advisable for the first bolt of this route if not feeling solid.

Power out the short but steep start and then rock onto an easy slab which leads up to a lip encounter near the top just before the anchors. The rope drag is heinous on your rope when lowering, so better to rap off this one.

Note - the shuts at the anchor are quite small in diameter and should be upgraded, as they seem more appropriate for hanging ferns

climbs.name: P.H.D.
climbs.fa: John Cardmon,  Rob Stauder, Bryan Muramoto & Brad Singer, June 2006

content.description:
This enjoyable route starts on the far left side of the face and features enjoyable moves up a slightly overhung face with positive holds. The first bolt is kinda high above a bad landing, so a stick clip may be prudent for shorter climbers.

Sidepulls along opposing aretes and edges work up the face to a hidden jug just past the second bolt. Continue up and left into an awkward flared, left-facing dihedral, pull a small roof and finish up a short section of easy face to anchors.

A bit dirty in the corner system, but the overall quality of the climbing and the novel moves make it easy to overlook this detail, and with more traffic this will only get better.

A powerful start gives way to an easy slab in the middle and then pulls into a left-facing corner with some engaging moves. The route finish up past a small roof which can be climbed directly or passed slightly to the right (easier).
content.location:
Located between

Funk Soul Sister

and

Trip Like I Do

, this route is another one here that climbs much better than it looks.

content.description:
Hidden but incut jugs lead up a short, steep face and into an easy mantle, above which easy slab moves gain a tricky headwall and another slab to finish.

Well-protected and quite varied despite it's short length, this is an enjoyable route that would be even better if the anchor was pulled and the last bolt doubled - as it is your rope gets shredded on a lip of rock. Best to rap off and pull your cord from about 20' back.
content.location:
Located between

Funk Soul Brother

and

Name of the Game

, this route climbs better than appearances might suggest.

content.description:
Boulder up a short face and then pull onto an easy slab which leads to a small ledge with a bush. Finish up a short left-facing corner system to anchors.

Decent climbing but not on par with the neighboring routes.
content.location:
Located around and right from

P.H.D.

and left of

Funk Soul Sister

and identifiable by the gold-colored bolt hangers.
